metadata.title: USN-5783-1 -- Linux kernel (OEM) vulnerability
metadata.description: Tam√°s Koczka discovered that the Bluetooth L2CAP handshake implementation in the Linux kernel contained multiple use-after-free vulnerabilities. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-5783-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-modules-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-tools-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-image-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-headers-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-oem-5.17-tools-host - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-modules-iwlwifi-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-oem-5.17-headers-5.17.0-1025 - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-buildinfo-5.17.0-1025-oem - 5.17.0-1025.26 linux-oem-5.17-tools-5.17.0-1025 - 5.17.0-1025.26 No subscription required  linux-image-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-headers-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-image-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-tools-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-tools-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-oem-22.04a - 5.17.0.1025.23 linux-headers-oem-22.04 - 5.17.0.1025.23 No subscription required
